docs.description: Execute an SQL statement

docs.description: Insert or update a record based on a logical condition using ON CONFLICT UPDATE

tags.title: example
tags.description:
upsertIf(
  dataValue('name'),
  'users', // the DB table
  'ON CONSTRAINT users_pkey', // a DB column with a unique constraint OR a CONSTRAINT NAME
  { name: 'Elodie', id: 7 },
  { writeSql:true, execute: true }
)

tags.title: param
tags.description: a data to check existing value for.
tags.name: logical

tags.title: param
tags.description: The target table
tags.name: table

tags.title: param
tags.description: The uuid column to determine a matching/existing record
tags.name: uuid

tags.title: param
tags.description: Payload data for the record as a JS object or function
tags.name: record

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional options argument
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: A string value that specifies the behavior for inserting null values.
tags.name: options.setNull

tags.description: A boolean value that specifies whether to log the generated SQL statement. Defaults to false.
tags.name: options.writeSql

tags.title: param
tags.description: A boolean value that specifies whether to execute the generated SQL statement. Defaults to false.

tags.description: A boolean value that specifies whether to log the inserted values to the console. Defaults to false.

param
tags.description: is the function
tags.name: func

docs.description: A custom operation that will only execute the function if the condition returns true

tags.title: example
tags.description: fnIf((state) => state?.data?.name, get("https://example.com"));

tags.description: The condition that returns true
tags.name: condition

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be executed.
tags.name: operation

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from source data.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: sourceValue('$.key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Ensures a path points at the data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataPath('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from the source data object—usually `state.data`.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: example
tags.description: dataValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `data`.
tags.name: path

docs.description: Picks out the last reference value from source data.

tags.title: example
tags.description: lastReferenceValue('key')

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `references`.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Scopes an array of data based on a JSONPath.
Useful when the source data has `n` items you would like to map to
an operation.
The operation will receive a slice of the data based of each item
of the JSONPath provided.

It also ensures the results of an operation make their way back into
the state's references.

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in `state`.
tags.name: dataSource

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be repeated.
tags.name: operation

docs.description: Combines two operations into one

tags.title: example
tags.description:
combine(
  create('foo'),
  delete('bar')
)

tags.title: param
tags.description: Operations to be performed.
tags.name: operations
